src.hairpin.HairpinCalculator

class HairpinCalculator(minimum_bind_len, min_stem=3, min_loop=3, max_loop=30)[source]

Bases: object

The class calculates a hairpin dg value for a sequence

Parameters

  • minimum_bind_len (int) – minimum continuous match length to form hairpin

  • min_stem (int) – minimum stem length

  • min_loop (int) – minimum loop length

  • max_loop (int) – maximum loop length

Notes

min loop represents the minimum loop size as below:

       .---.
    ATGC    \
        A    min_loop=3
ATGCATGC    /
       \___/

Methods

calculate_hairpin_dg

The function calculates hairpin dg value for the given sequence.

get_max_stem_dg

With the given two sequences, it calculates the maximum stem dg value.

get_max_stem_dg_from_match

With the given matched nucleotides, decompose DEGs and calculate the maximum stem dG

get_stem_dg

It sums up all stem dg values achieved from string slicing

validate_input_sequence

Validate that length of user input sequence is not shorter than minimum length
calculate_hairpin_dg(seq)[source]

The function calculates hairpin dg value for the given sequence.

Parameters

seq (str) – sequence

Return type

Tuple[bool, float, str]

Returns

tuple containing

  • is_hairpin (bool): true if there is a predicted hairpin structure else false

  • hairpin_dg (float): Min hairpin dg if there is a result else 999.0

  • hairpin_form (str): Detail information is joined with “:;:” It consists of loop length, loop dg, max stem dg, upper sequences, binding pattern and lower sequences.

get_max_stem_dg(seq_up, seq_dw)[source]

With the given two sequences, it calculates the maximum stem dg value. “N” and “I” are regarded as a DEG.

Parameters

  • seq_up (str) – sequence as a string

  • seq_dw (str) – sequence as a string

get_max_stem_dg_from_match(match_seq)[source]

With the given matched nucleotides, decompose DEGs and calculate the maximum stem dG

Parameters

match_seq (str) – Matched sequences

Return type

float

Returns

Maximum stem dG

get_stem_dg(seq)[source]

It sums up all stem dg values achieved from string slicing

validate_input_sequence(seq_len)[source]

Validate that length of user input sequence is not shorter than minimum length

Parameters

seq_len (int) – sequence length
